description: Triangle of numbers T(n,k) = number of permutations of (1,2,...,n) with longest increasing subsequence of length k (1<=k<=n).
comments: Mirror image of triangle in A126065.T(n,m) is also the sum of squares of n!/(product of hook lengths), summed over the partitions of n in exactly m parts (Robinson-Schensted correspondence). - _Wouter Meeussen_, Sep 16 2010Table I "Distribution of L_n" on p. 98 of the Pilpel reference. - _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 13 2013In general, for column k is a(n) ~ product(j!, j=0..k-1) * k^(2*n+k^2/2) / (2^((k-1)*(k+2)/2) * Pi^((k-1)/2) * n^((k^2-1)/2)) (result due to Regev) . - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 18 2014

maple: h:= proc(l) local n; n:= nops(l); add(i, i=l)! /mul(mul(1+l[i]-j      +add(`if`(l[k]>=j, 1, 0), k=i+1..n), j=1..l[i]), i=1..n) end:g:= (n, i, l)-> `if`(n=0 or i=1, h([l[], 1$n])^2, `if`(i<1, 0,                add(g(n-i*j, i-1, [l[], i$j]), j=0..n/i))):T:= n-> seq(g(n-k, min(n-k, k), [k]), k=1..n):seq(T(n), n=1..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 05 2012
mathematica: Table[Total[NumberOfTableaux[#]^2&/@ IntegerPartitions[n,{k}]],{n,7},{k,n}] (* _Wouter Meeussen_, Sep 16 2010, revised Nov 19 2013 *)h[l_List] := Module[{n = Length[l]}, Total[l]!/Product[Product[1+l[[i]]-j+Sum[If[l[[k]] >= j, 1, 0], {k, i+1, n}], {j, 1, l[[i]]}], {i, 1, n}]]; g[n_, i_, l_List] := If[n == 0 || i == 1, h[Join[l, Array[1&, n]]]^2, If[i<1, 0, Sum[g[n-i*j, i-1, Join[l, Array[i&, j]]], {j, 0, n/i}]]]; T[n_] := Table[g[n-k, Min[n-k, k], {k}], {k, 1, n}]; Table[T[n], {n, 1, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Mar 06 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
